DataElement.preferredName: Diffuse Gastric Adenocarcinoma Predominant Subtype WHO Criterion Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to describe the predominant subtype of diffuse stomach adenocarcinoma using WHO criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Diffuse Gastric Adenocarcinoma Predominant WHO Criterion Subtype
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An adenocarcinoma arising from the stomach.  Microscopically, it is characterized by the presence of a diffuse infiltrate, composed of individual adenocarcinoma cells or groups of adenocarcinoma cells in a fibrous or mucoid stroma.  Many cells contain mucin droplets, producing a signet-ring configuration._Most important; principal._A United Nations agency established to coordinate international health activities and to help governments improve health services._Criteria; a basis for comparison; a reference point against which other things can be evaluated._A group forming a type within a larger type.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An adenocarcinoma arising from the stomach.  Microscopically, it is characterized by the presence of a diffuse infiltrate, composed of individual adenocarcinoma cells or groups of adenocarcinoma cells in a fibrous or mucoid stroma.  Many cells contain mucin droplets, producing a signet-ring configuration.

Concepts.definition: An adenocarcinoma arising from the stomach.  Microscopically, it is characterized by the presence of a diffuse infiltrate, composed of individual adenocarcinoma cells or groups of adenocarcinoma cells in a fibrous or mucoid stroma.  Many cells contain mucin droplets, producing a signet-ring configuration.

Property.preferredName: Main World Health Organization Criterion Subtype
Property.preferredDefinition: Most important; principal.:A United Nations agency established to coordinate international health activities and to help governments improve health services.:Criteria; a basis for comparison; a reference point against which other things can be evaluated.:A group forming a type within a larger type.

Concepts.definition: A United Nations agency established to coordinate international health activities and to help governments improve health services.
That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.
A group forming a type within a larger type.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Diffuse Gastric Adenocarcinoma WHO Criterion Sub Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An adenocarcinoma arising from the stomach.  Microscopically, it is characterized by the presence of a diffuse infiltrate, composed of individual adenocarcinoma cells or groups of adenocarcinoma cells in a fibrous or mucoid stroma.  Many cells contain mucin droplets, producing a signet-ring configuration._A United Nations agency established to coordinate international health activities and to help governments improve health services._That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

PermissibleValues.value: Unable to distinguish between non-signet ring and signet ring

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An adenocarcinoma that arises from the gastric mucosa and is characterized by the presence of isolated malignant cells or malignant cells that form small aggregates.  This category includes signet ring cell adenocarcinomas, adenocarcinomas that are composed of malignant cells resembling lymphocytes and histiocytes, and adenocarcinomas that are composed of malignant cells with deeply eosinophilic cytoplasm.

Concepts.definition: An adenocarcinoma that arises from the gastric mucosa and is characterized by the presence of isolated malignant cells or malignant cells that form small aggregates.  This category includes signet ring cell adenocarcinomas, adenocarcinomas that are composed of malignant cells resembling lymphocytes and histiocytes, and adenocarcinomas that are composed of malignant cells with deeply eosinophilic cytoplasm.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A poorly cohesive gastric adenocarcinoma characterized by malignant cells containing intracytoplasmic mucin.

Concepts.definition: A poorly cohesive gastric adenocarcinoma characterized by malignant cells containing intracytoplasmic mucin.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Exclusion Signet Ring Adenocarcinoma Cell Poorly Cohesive Gastric Carcinoma

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Exclusion Signet Ring Adenocarcinoma Cell Poorly Cohesive Gastric Carcinoma
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The deliberate act of omission.: A malignant glandular cell containing cytoplasmic mucin. The presence of mucin pushes the nucleus of the cell to the periphery, assuming a configuration resembling a signet ring.: An adenocarcinoma that arises from the gastric mucosa and is characterized by the presence of isolated malignant cells or malignant cells that form small aggregates.  This category includes signet ring cell adenocarcinomas, adenocarcinomas that are composed of malignant cells resembling lymphocytes and histiocytes, and adenocarcinomas that are composed of malignant cells with deeply eosinophilic cytoplasm.

Concepts.definition: A malignant glandular cell containing cytoplasmic mucin. The presence of mucin pushes the nucleus of the cell to the periphery, assuming a configuration resembling a signet ring.

An adenocarcinoma that arises from the gastric mucosa and is characterized by the presence of isolated malignant cells or malignant cells that form small aggregates.  This category includes signet ring cell adenocarcinomas, adenocarcinomas that are composed of malignant cells resembling lymphocytes and histiocytes, and adenocarcinomas that are composed of malignant cells with deeply eosinophilic cytoplasm.
